gurmukhi: ਬੀਰ ਹਨਯੋ ਜਬ ਹੀ ਰਨ ਮੈ ਤਬ ਦੂਸਰ ਕੇ ਮਨ ਕੋਪ ਛਯੋ ॥ ਸੁ ਧਵਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਸਯੰਦਨ ਤਾਹੀ ਕੀ ਓਰ ਗਯੋ ਅਸ ਤੀਛਨ ਪਾਨ ਲਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Beer Hanyo Jab Hiran Mai Tab Doosar Ke Man Kop Chhayo|| Su Dhavaae Kai Syandan Taahikior Gado As Teechhan Paan Layo||
translation: When this warrior was killed, then the second (Jujhan Singh) got infuriated in his mind; he caused his chariot to be driven and immediately taking his sword in his hand, went towards him (Kharag Singh);

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਭੂਪ ਸਰਾਸਨ ਬਾਨ ਲਯੋ ਅਰਿ ਕੋ ਅਸ ਮੂਡ ਤੇ ਕਾਟੇ ਦਯੋ ॥ ਮਾਨੋ ਜੀਹ ਨਿਕਾਰ ਕੈ ਧਾੲਿਓ ਹੁਤੋ ਜਮੁ ਜੀਭ ਕਟੀ ਬਿਨ ਅਾਸ ਭਯੋ ॥੧੪੨੬॥
transliteration: Tab Bhoop Saraasan Baan Layo Ar(i) Ko S Moond Te Kaate Dayo Maano Jeeh Nikaar Kai Dhaaio Houto Jam(u) Jeebh Katibin Aas Bhayo||1426||
translation: Then the king also chopped off his head with his bow and arrows and he appeared like the one going forward greedily moving his tongue, but on account of the cutting away of his tongue, his hopes of getting relish had ended.1426.

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਹੀ ਕਰਿ ਕੋ ਅਸ ਕਾਟਿ ਦਯੋ ਭਟ ਜੋੳੂ ਭਜੇ ਹੁਤੇ ਤੇ ਸਭ ਧਾੲੇ ॥ ਅਾਯੁਧ ਲੈ ਅਪਨੇ ਅਪਨੇ ਕਰ ਚਿੱਤ ਬਿਖੈ ਅਤਿ ਕੋਪ ਬਢਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Jab Hikar(i) Ko As Kaattee Dayo Bhat Jeoo Bhaje Houte Te Sabh Dhaae|| Ooyudh Lai Apne Apne Kar Chitt Bikhai At(i) Kop Badhaae||
translation: When he chopped the warrior huge like elephant with his sword, then all other warriors who were there, fell upon him; they had got enraged taking their weapons in their hands;

gurmukhi: ਬੀਰ ਬਨੈਤ ਬਨੇ ਸਿਗਰੇ ਤਿਨ ਕੇ ਗੁਨ ਸਯਾਮ ਕਬੀਸ਼ਰ ਗਾੲੇ ॥ ਮਾਨਹੁ ਭੂਪ ਸੁਅੰਬਰ ਜੁੱਧੁ ਰਚਯੋ ਭਟ ੲੇਨ ਬਡੇ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਅਾੲੇ ॥੧੪੨੭॥
transliteration: Beer Banait Hane Sigre Tin Ke Soun Syaam Kabeeshar Gade|| Maanoh Bhoop Suanbar Juddh(u) Rachyo Bhat En Bade Nrip Aae||14427||
translation: They were the praiseworthy warriors and appeared to have gathered as other kings gathered in the ceremony of swayamvara performed by a king.1427.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਸਾਮੁਹਿ ਅਾੲਿ ਭਿਰੇ ਅਰਿ ਬਾਨਨ ਸੋ ਸੋੲੀ ਮਾਰ ਲੀੲੇ ਹੈ ॥ ਕੇਤਕਿ ਜੋਰਿ ਭਿਰੇ ਹਠਿ ਕੈ ਕਿਤਨੇ ਰਨ ਕੋ ਲਖਿ ਭਾਜਿ ਗੲੇ ਹੈ ॥
transliteration: Je Nrip Saamuh(i) Aae Bhire Ar(i) Baanan So Soimaar Leee Hai|| Ketak(i) Jor(i) Bhire Hath(i) Kai Kitne Ran Ko Lakh(i) Bhaaj(i) Gad Hai||
translation: All the enemies who came in front of the king, he knocked them down with his arrows; there were many who fought persistently, but there were also many who ran away;

gurmukhi: ਕੇਤਕਿ ਹੋੲਿ ੲਿਕਤ੍ਰ ਰਹੈ ਜਸੁ ਤਾ ਛਬਿ ਕੋ ਕਬਿ ਚੀਨ ਲੲੇ ਹੈ ॥ ਮਾਨਹੁ ਅਾਗ ਲਗੀ ਬਨ ਮੈ ਮਦ ਮੱਤ ਕਰੀ ੲਿਕ ਠੳੁਰ ਭੲੇ ਹੈ ॥੧੪੨੮॥
transliteration: Ketak(i) Hoe Ikatra Rahai Jas(u) Taa Chhab(i) Ko Kabi Cheen Lae Hai|| Maanoh Aag Lagiban Mai Mad Matt Kariik Thaur Bhae Hai||1428||
translation: Many kings had gathered at one place and appeared like the intoxicated elephant gathered together at one place in the event of the forest-fire.1428.

gurmukhi: ਬੀਰ ਘਨੇ ਰਨ ਮਾਂਝ ਹਨੇ ਮਨ ਮੈ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਰੰਚਕ ਕੋਪ ਭਰਯੋ ਹੈ ॥ ਬਾਜ ਕਰੀ ਰਥ ਕਾਟਿ ਦੲੇ ਜਬ ਹੀ ਕਰਿ ਮੈ ਕਰਵਾਰ ਧਰਯੋ ਹੈ ॥
transliteration: Beer Ghane Ran Maanjh Hane Man Mai Nrip Ranchak Kop Bdaryo Hai|| Baaj Karirath Kaattee Dae Jab Hikar(i) Mai Karvaarr Ddaryo Hai||
translation: Killing many warriors in the battlefield, the king Kharag Singh became somewhat furious; as soon as he caught hold of the sword he knocked down visibly many elephants, horses and chariots;

gurmukhi: ਪੇਖ ਕੈ ਸ਼ੱਤ੍ਰ ੲਿਕਤ੍ਰ ਭੲੇ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਮਾਰਬੇ ਕੋ ਤਿਨ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਕਰਯੋ ਹੈ ॥ ਕੇਹਰਿ ਕੋ ਬਧ ਜਿੳੁ ਚਿਤਵੈ ਮ੍ਰਿਗ ਸੋ ਤੋ ਬ੍ਰਿਥਾ ਕਬਹੂੰ ਨ ਡਰਯੋ ਹੈ ॥੧੪੨੯॥
transliteration: Pekh Kai Shattra Ikatra Bhae Nrip Maarbe Ko Tin Mantra Daryo Hai|| Kehar(i) Ko Badh Jio Chitvai Mrig So To Brithaa Kab-hoon Na Daryo Hai||1429||
translation: Seeing him the enemies gathered and began to think of killing him; it appeared like the deer gathered together in order to kill the lion and the lion remained standing fearlessly.1429.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਪ ਬਲੀ ਬਹੁਰੋ ਰਿਸਕੈ ਜਬ ਹਾਥਨ ਮੈ ਹਥਿਯਾਰ ਗਹੇ ਹੈ ॥ ਸੂਰ ਹਨੇ ਬਲਬੰਡ ਘਨੇ ਕਬਿ ਰਾਮ ਭਨੈ ਚਿਤ ਮੈ ਜੁ ਚਹੇ ਹੈ ॥
transliteration: Bhoop Balibahuro Ris-kai Jab Haathan Mai Hathiyaar Gade Haai|| Soor Hane Blband Ghane Kabi Raam Bhanai Chit Mai Ju Chache Hai||
translation: When the mighty king, in his anger, taking his weapons in his hand, killed the warriors according to his heart’s desire;
